page.title: 15CHURCHES
page.content: { WOODHORN}LIES WITHIN A MILE OF THE SEA NEAR NEWBIGGIN.INDEED THE NAME MEANS A WOODED POINT OF LAND.IT KEEPS MUCH OF ITS CHARACTER.IN 1973 WOODHORN WAS DECLARED REDUNDENT BY THE CHURCH COMMISSIONERS AND SERVICES TRACFERRED TO NEIGHBOURING SAINT BARTOLOMEWS CHURCH AT NEWBIGGIN.WOODHORN WAS THEN ACQUIRED BY THE ASHINGTON URBAN {DISTRICT COUNCIL}FOR USE AS A{MUSEUM AND CULTURAL CENTRE.SOMETIMES YOU CAN DO BRASS RUBBINGS THERE IS ALSO A SLIDE SHOW.THERE ARE STUFFED ANIMALS IN CASES AND A LITTLE WHILE AGO THERE WAS A{PROGGY MAT}DISPLAY.WE WENT TO SEE AND HAVE A GO AT IT WHICH WAS INTERESTING THERE WERE DIFFERENT HOOKS TO USE.THE WOMAN TOLD US THAT HER GRANDUAGHTER HAD MADE A MAT BY HERSELF TO GO INFRONT OF THE FIRE.COW HORNS AND HALF CLOTHES PEGS WERE SOME OF THE TOOLS USED.
